name: macaboi

name: chaesar
text: It's ok you guys, asherdan just doesn't know what words mean.

name: andyfaewatford
text:
Actually, I took another look at the strip because asherdan's comment just made no sense to me at all. I think he's implying that because Eric is from Glasgow and has no job, that's kind of being racist against Glaswegans, or the Scottish. However, I actually live in Glasgow, and seeing recognition of the dear green place did not make me think that Onstad was being at all racist. I guess asherdan's just sensitive.

p.s. The name 'Glasow' derives from the Gaelic for 'dear green place.' This is not actually as ironic as many people think.

name: moraiat
text:
"the strip from 1/21/03"

http://achewood.com/index.php?date=01212003

name: prettyrad
text: Strips with panels and shirts do not mix. People ain't gonna spend sixty seconds starin' at your chest if your name is Eric.

name: woodenteeth
text:
Eric = 20 seconds.
John = .01 seconds (John has one of those unfortunate concave varieties).
David = 20 minutes (David frequents Day Clubs and wears those shirts with electronic logos on them)
Pamela = 60 seconds. It is not because she wears comics on her shirt. Wait... what shirt?

name: tekende
text: ...what?

name: woodenteeth
text: I was classifying how long people look at a group of fictitious people's chests and for what reasons.

name: fineoakstructure
text: this is all very funny after a number of beers and a three fingers of bourbon

text: Chris' Treble-clef "S" is in fact a stylized G.

text:

text: It really does suck when you colon comes off in the wash. (I imagine it also sucks when your period sticks to problematic areas.)

name: skoora
text: Bucked-tooth Cats: The bastards of evolution.

name: l_c_b
text: The Uninsured motorist drives around in a small pickup truck, like an Isuzu Pup or Cheverolet S-10, the tailgate replaced by one of those rubbery webbing things, streaks and squiggles of rust running along the edges of the hood and fenders...the space inside behind the seat is filled with old burger wrappers, empty pizza boxes, half-full bottles of soda and empty packs of either Camels or generic cigarettes. The uninsured motorist has another set of Oakley's in his glove compartment.
